newsitem.title: UK: British Steel to cut 10,000 jobs in five yrs.
newsitem.headline: British Steel to cut 10,000 jobs in five yrs.

text.p: British Steel, fighting a strong pound and tough overseas competition, will cut up to 10,000 jobs over the next five years, the Guardian reported on Thursday.
The paper said the steel giant would announce the job reduction plan to unions on Friday.
"The job cuts, out of a UK workforce of 43,000, will be imposed on management as well as the shopfloor and affect several regions with high unemployment," said the Guardian.
British Steel has plants in South Wales, Teesside, Scunthorpe, Scotland and Rotherham.

The paper said the company's personnel director Allan Johnston had summoned the ISTC steel union and the AEEU engineering union to meetings in London on Friday at which he was expected to spell out the cost-cutting programme.

The steel giant would also unveil proposals to tighten financial controls on its purchase of raw materials, step up workforce training and introduce more effective use of information technology across all business processes.
